text: Timothy Richard "Tim" Tebow (born August 14, 1987) is a retired American football quarterback. He is currently an analyst for the SEC Network. Tebow played college football for the Florida Gators. In 2007, he became the first sophomore (second-year) player to win the Heisman Trophy. Tebow was the 25th person drafted in the 2010 NFL Draft.Tim Tebow drafted by Denver Broncos He played college football at The University of Florida. He is known for his running ability and strong Christian beliefs (made "Tebowing, or Tebow's version of kneeling in prayer, famous), as well as late-game heroics. During the 2011 season, Tim Tebow played 7 games including his OT win over the Steelers in the playoffs. On March 21, 2012, Tebow was traded by the Broncos to the New York Jets. He then played briefly for the New England Patriots in 2013 and Philadelphia Eagles in 2015. He created a gesture called "Tebowing". ==References== Category:1987 births Category:Living people Category:Denver Broncos players Category:American football quarterbacks Category:New York Jets players
title: Tim Tebow
